direction.raw_text: written by Marty Kaplan HOLLYWOOD PICTURES                     PRODUCTION REVISION 500 South Buena Vista Burbank, CA 91521                      March 17, 1992 (818) 560-3370 THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92 FADE IN: 1   A FLASH OF LIGHT                                            1 A radiant shiny something dazzling in EXTREME CLOSEUP. BEGIN TITLES. CAMERA very slowly PULLS   BACK. The sparkling surface turns out to be a lot of   carats. WE SEE the stone, then the ring, then suddenly,   in b.g., something HUGE SWEEPS by. REVEAL a mechanical    claw above the ring, hanging from a crane. The ring    sits in a sea of tiny dolls, joke eyeballs, and other   carnival junk. The claw descends on the ring again and again, sometimes catching it for a moment then tragically dropping it -- accompanied by OOHS and AAHS (O.S.) of hope and disap- pointment. INTERCUT with the HANDS of a young black man working the controls. The EYES of a young black woman watching him work. Another guy's HANDS digging in his pocket for change. QUARTERS going into the slot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This'll never work, Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be positive, Armando. Course it will. The claw inadvertently snags a rabbit's foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look.   See what a lucky fuck I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He don't mean the ring, hon, he means the whole plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do I. The claw catches the   ring and closes on it. QUICK CUTS of their FACES as the   crane rises. A very pretty lady. A beefy Latino with a   two-day beard. Their apprehension. Tommy's confidence.    Then his exceptional smile. He gets the ring. 2   INT. PENNY ARCADE - DAY                                     2 TOMMY Okay -- one down, one to go. (returning to the claw) You got quarters, Loretta? END TITLES. THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              2. 3   EXT. FLORIDA LUXURY HOTEL - DAY                             3 Palm trees. The smell of money. Valets in Foreign Legion khakis greeting arriving luxury cars. 4   INT. HOTEL FUNCTION ROOM - DAY                              4 A big crowd of GUESTS at a cocktail reception. A lot of lime jackets, cherry trousers, and blue hair. People wear name tags. ON Tommy, in pastel bow tie and full waiter drag, con- firming orders for a group of guests. He speaks in a PRISSY, OVER-SOLICITIOUS VOICE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a diet ginger ale, an extra- spicy virgin mary no salt, a club soda -- good choice -- a lime rickey, and a bourbon and a planter's punch. Five people, five drinks... it's Kismet! Tommy turns away, looking toward the entrance to the room. 5   INT. LOBBY - DAY - CLOSE SHOT - THE RING                    5 glittering on Loretta's finger. LORETTA, stunning in designer clothing and accessories, enters. Her looks attract looks. 6   INT. FUNCTION ROOM - DAY                                    6 Tommy, maintaining his vantage point, repeats another order, this time in a heavy CARRIBEAN ACCENT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a vodka tonic, a Pellegrino, lime and no ice, a gin Gibson straight up with ex-tra onions
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am also fond of de onions -- and a Chardonnary spritzer...also with extra onions -- no, no, do not worry, that is just a little joke. There will be no onions whatsoever in your spritzer! He LAUGHS HUGELY, rather amused with himself.   The guests aren't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't need to write it down? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            3. 6   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Memory?   Do not make me laugh! He LAUGHS HUGELY, turns, takes two steps away and makes absolutely no effort to get their drinks. He looks toward the door. 7   INT. HALLWAY/ENTRANCE TO FUNCTION ROOM - DAY              7 Loretta approaches the function room, where pert  DEBBIE, wearing a JOHNSON FOR CONGRESS button, staffs a  felt- covered table. On  a nearby easel, a photo of a  silver- haired Man with a legend in blue and gold: JEFF   JOHNSON. THE NAME YOU KNOW.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not too late, am I, dear? (extending a hand) Hello, darling, Alma Preston, how are you today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for coming, Ms. Preston, I'm Debbie Bartle. (consulting a list) Do we have your check yet? Loretta pulls a Mont Blanc pen and a checkbook from her bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, honey, I don't think you do, we just got in last night from our place in Barbados -- how much is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five hundred a person.   Barbados?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, we're just down the beach from Mick Jagger and Jerry. (looking up) You wouldn't turn down a couple of thousand, would you? A pleased smile from Debbie. Loretta opens the check- book, flashing the immense RING in front of Debbie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, that's a lovely ring. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              4. 7   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, thank you. I thought it might be a little gaudy...who should I make this out to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnson for Congress. It's not gaudy, it's just...nice and big.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my Carlos...I can't even look in a store window. We're walking down this street in Rio, we pass a jewelry store...I didn't even turn my head and he's in the shop... (holds up ring) ...$250,000. I said it's crazy... but you know Carlos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I did. ON Tommy watching Loretta. A Guest standing just behind Tommy -- wearing MRS. ZEKE BRIDGES name tag -- watches JEFF JOHNSON gladhand the room robustly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear they had him open for six hours. ZEKE, a very fat cigar-smoker, marvels at Johnson's appearance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sum' bitch looks terrific. Tommy, eavesdropping, joins Zeke's chuckle, which unfor- tunately turns into a wheeze and then a cough. Zeke turns to Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about taking our orders, son?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely my friend!    How can I pleasure you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bourbon straight up and a Perrier rocks for the lady. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             5. 7   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah! Fire and ice! Wonderful! But may I suggest you make that a double sir? After all, so many guests, so few of me -- who knows when I may be back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, why not. AT THE ENTRANCE LORETTA pauses before going into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know where the powder room is, hon? I should freshen my face before I go in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just over there. ON JEFF JOHNSON with his well-groomed wife, VERA, and a barrel-chested Man in full resort wear, wearing an OLAF ANDERSEN name tag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how the heck are you, Olaf?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should be asking how you are, congressman. Johnson pats his chest and smiles at Vera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This old ticker never felt better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's good to see you back on your feet, Jeff. We need you in Washington. Inconspicuously, a pretty young redhead whispers to Vera. This is JENNIFER, Johnson's Administrative Assistant (his AA).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that granddaughter of yours, Olaf? Ready for the Olympics?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll be thrilled you asked after her. 8   IN THE HALLWAY Loretta emerges from the Ladies' Room...    8 catches a spike heel... recovers her balance... then frantically searches her hands and clothes, SCREAMS, and gets down on hands and knees. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             6. 8   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God!    My God! Oh my God! Debbie rushes over to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My --   my ring. My diamond. I took it off   in the ladies' room to wash my hands.    I was just putting it on -- I must   have dropped it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me help you, we'll find it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call Security! 9   IN THE FUNCTION ROOM Tommy maintains his watch on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loretta. Zeke Bridges taps Tommy on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, what about our drinks? Tommy instantly assumes an ANGRY YOUNG STREET BLACK VOICE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?    What you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?    You already took our order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That wasn't me! You must be thinking of Jamal. I'm Karim. What you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bourbon straight up and a Perrier rocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hunh. He walks two steps...and once again makes no attempt to get the drinks. Zeke returns to Jeff Johnson. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             7. 9    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get me wrong, Jeff. Pyramid Insurance doesn't want special breaks. I just think we ought to be able to set our own rates without Uncle Sam sticking his nose in our business. Johnson signals Jennifer to come over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know my AA? Zeke Bridges, this is Jennifer, my Administrative Assistant. Zeke's been a tremendous help to us. I'd like you to listen to his view on health insurance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be very happy to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At Pyramid Insurance, we call our approach the Patient's Bill of Rights. 10   IN THE HALLWAY Loretta and Debbie are on hands and      10 knees, still looking. A pair of shoes comes INTO FRAME. They LOOK up at a bullet-headed man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ms. Preston?   Bruno Handler, hotel security.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My ring!   My ring! Oh my god...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now just calm down, Ma'am... can you describe the ring?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a diamond ring! A big diamond ring! Oh my Christ! She's frantic.   Debbie takes Bruno aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw it. It's huge... it must be like eight carats. She says it was a quarter of a million dollars! Bruno turns back to Loretta, trying to calm her. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             8. 10   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am... calm down.   Now, is the ring insured?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course it's insured! But you know how it works -- if I report it, they'll cancel me. And I don't want another ring! I need this ring! The ring Carlos gave me. Bruno turns, speaks into the walkie-talkie he's carrying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the fuck is housekeeping? I called for those dickheads ninety seconds ago. 11   IN THE FUNCTION ROOM the Guests have gathered to hear      11 Johnson speak. As Andersen introduces him, Tommy con- tinues eyeing Loretta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I won't run through Jeff's record -- he's been in Congress twenty years, and I've only got two minutes. I'll just say this: When those of us in pharmaceuticals, or agribusiness, or insurance, or (indicating himself) utilities, or you name it -- when we've needed him, Jeff's been there for us. And we've been there for Jeff, too -- we raised a hundred thousand dollars today! (APPLAUSE) Without further ado, our man in Washington, Jefferson Davis Johnson. 12   IN THE HALLWAY Debbie hears the APPLAUSE (O.S.).   She     12 gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should be in there. Good luck, Ms. Preston. I hope you find it. She leaves.   Loretta, mascara smeared, gets up, as does Bruno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't go in there like this. God! Please... listen... I'll pay a ten thousand dollar reward for anybody who finds my ring. Just don't tell Carlos! (suddenly grim) He'll kill me. THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            9. 13   IN THE FUNCTION ROOM, as Johnson takes questions, Tommy    13 slips out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you make of all this campaign reform business, Jeff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, y'know Ernie... these days, everyone's down on the political action committees and so-called special interests. But, heck, I think you and Fran have a right to participate in our democracy in exactly the way you're doing today. I'm in Congress to represent you. I don't want any so-called reform to take that power away from you. 14   APPLAUSE (O.S.). IN THE HALLWAY Bruno issues orders to     14 two Maintenance Men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want every heating grate opened and inspected. I want every air conditioning duct vacuumed. Do you understand what I'm saying? AS he speaks, Bruno SEES Tommy pass through the hallway ... spot something on the floor... pick it up... furtive- ly put it in his pocket... and walk rapidly toward the door to the kitchens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you! Waiter! Hold it right there! Bruno puts an arm on Tommy. Tommy instantly assumes a frantic, wimpy, craven persona, along wth his CARRIBBEAN ACCENT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Please! Do not report me! I will be deported!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down.   What've you got in your pocket?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told the CIA everything! I agreed to poison the pineapples! My green card is in the mail! (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             10. 14   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stow it! I'm not Immigration, I'm hotel security. Now, what did you just put in your pocket?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm warning you, flathead, get cute with me and I will tear you a second asshole. Now a valuable diamond ring is mising...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valuable? We can almost see the light bulb click on above Bruno's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very valuable. All right, I'll give you a hunnert bucks for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hundred and five? Bruno snorts agreement, goes for his wallet... Tommy goes gor the ring... then suddenly leaps back in a cringe!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! It's a trick! You will call me a thief and send me back and the Security Police will make me stand on my head in the guano pit! I have seen such things on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Bruno snaps and GRABS TOMMY BY THE COLLAR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, I'm not trying to trick you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no... it is a trap! I must turn this over to police. He starts to leave.   Bruno grabs him. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              11. 14   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, dipshit... a valuable ring is missing and there's thousands of dollars in reward money waiting. So you'd better fork over...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How big is this... reward? Another lightbulb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, five hundred dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said 'thousands.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.     Right.    A thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no...you said thousands. With an 'S'. This is plural. This means "two or more thousands."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, you win. Two thousand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or more.     Two or more. Bruno's had enough -- his grip tightens around Tommy's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just making a point. 15   IN HOTEL LOBBY AT THE CASHIER'S DESK Bruno slides a
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IN HOTEL LOBBY AT THE CASHIER'S DESK

direction.raw_text: check to the Cashier, who counts a stack of bills. Bruno picks up a house phone, dials. 16   INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAY                                        16 ARMANDO, still unshaven, answers the RINGING phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? INTERCUT with Bruno in the lobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, may I speak with Ms. Preston? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              12. 16   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's in the bathroom. This is Carlos. Can I take a message?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks, I'll call back. ARMANDO hangs up the phone and exits the hotel room. BRUNO crosses to the far side of the lobby, where Tommy waits inconspicuously. He gives him the money. Tommy gives him ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now get back to work! As Tommy heads back to the function room, Bruno picks up a house phone, dials, listens. He dials again, listens. No answer. He dials the operator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Bruno in Security. Put me through to 502 -- there must be something wrong with the line, I can't get an answer... What do you mean, there's no one in 502? I just spoke to them!... No one's registered in 502? Are you sure?... Well, check again!... Shit! He hangs up, looks at the ring, and realizes he's been taken. His face twisting with rage, he hurries after Tommy. 17   ON TOMMY MOVING swiftly through the function room toward 17 an exit. Zeke Bridges grabs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!   Where the hell are our drinks. Surprised, Tommy opts for an EAST INDIAN ACCENT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember... you were the sloe gin fizz and the mango daquiri? With perhaps a small umbrella for the lady?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bourbon neat and a Perrier, dammit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And would you still be wanting the umbrella then? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             13. 17   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Olaf, there's something I wanted to sound you out on. As a special friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoot. Tommy moves away from the pillar, sees Bruno roaming the terrace, and retreats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thinking of retiring from Congress. Andersen's eyes widen in astonishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thinking maybe I won't run. Maybe I should listen more (indicating his heart) to this. Really appreciate these years. Sail around the world. Climb mountains. Enjoy the finer things of life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff. Listen to me. You can't retire. Florida needs you. I need you. I need you on rates. I need you on regulations. I need you on those environmental nutcases -- JOHNSON Olaf, if I retire this year, I get to keep all the money left over in my campaign treasury. Comes to a very tidy nest-egg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How tidy? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             14. 18   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One-point-three million. (chuckles) It's called the grandfather loophole. Bruno has gone.   But Tommy stays.   His eyes light up at the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Jeff. Look at what you'd be giving up. Going to the best resorts in the world and calling it "official business." Golfing and skiing and fishing, and never picking up a tab. And, Jeff -- there's no aphrodisiac like power. You can have some of the most intelligent, attractive women in the country. You've got it made!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I suppose that one-point-three may seem like spare change to the head of Gulf Coast Power, but to a country boy like me -- ANDERSEN Okay, Jeff. I get it. Look. There's a little software company that's about to go through the roof. Johnson smiles at the direction the conversation is taking. ON Tommy also smiling, in admiration at the transaction going down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few thousand worth of stock options would stand to make you quite a pile. As long as your blind trust buys them, you're clean -- the SEC can't shake a stick at you. Half a million, easy -- and that's just a start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if you put it like that... I now see I have a duty to continue my career in public service. Johnson stands, puts his arm on Andersen. Tommy emerges, shakes his head, and laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in the wrong business. THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92                   14A. 19   EXT. BAIT SHACK - DAY                                          19 A ramshackle bait shack, paint peeling, on the inland waterway. At the rear of the shack, Armando shoots hoops into a tattered net. Loretta, back in jeans, looks at her watch. A bondo-patched Econoline van pulls up. Tommy jumps out, big smile. He gives Loretta an energetic round of APPLAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The best li'l roper in America! But she doesn't want the charm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You took your time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cops bust you, Tommy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Busted?   Moi?    Fuck no. He pulls out the wad of bills.       Their faces brighten considerably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That look like busted? 20   EXT. CAPITOL - NIGHT                                           20 Washington, D.C.   The illuminated dome of the Capitol. 21   INT. CONGRESSIONAL OFFICE - NIGHT                              21 CAMERA ROAMS the well-hung walls. From the photos and memorabilia, we realize that we are in the office of Rep. Jeff Johnson. In the reflections on the frames, we GLIMPSE some MOVEMENT on the desk explaining the considerable BREATHING and MOANING (O.S.).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God.     Oh my God. Oh my... But then a strange GURGLING sound (O.S.) escapes from Johnson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... God. A silent beat.   Then a horrified CRY.      Jennifer rises INTO FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my god! THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            14B. 22   INT. CHURCH - FLORIDA - DAY                               22 The congregation is SINGING. We SEE the widow Johnson. At her side, in the aisle seat, a powerful man with bushy eyebrows, about 60, in a three-piece suit and watch chain: congressman DICK DODGE. The HYMN ends. Dodge steps up to the pulpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was my honor to serve in Congress with Jeff Johnson for a generation. No one could have been a better legislator. No one could have been a finer husband and father. And now -- He presses the tips of his fingers together and looks skyward, as if communing with his memory of the deceased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now God has called his servant home. ANGLE ON Jennifer, in black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will miss him. But we are grateful that his passing was so peaceful -- and so like him -- working late into the night at his desk, the consummate public servant. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 22   CONTINUED:                                                    22 Vera sneaks a look at Jennifer, who is poker-faced. 23   EXT./INT. VERANDA/JOHNSON HOME - DAY                          23 On the veranda of the gracious  home, mourners pay respects to the family. Dodge   puts a gentle hand on the widow's shoulder and draws  her aside. He throws a look at Jennifer, who joins  them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vera, I know you're still in shock from Jeff's... passing. But we have to talk about his seat. Vera stares at Jennifer.   She knows the score.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Johnson, if you'd like to discuss this in private -- VERA You can stay -- what's the difference?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vera, I'd like you to announce that you're going to run for Congress. Let a few days pass to show proper respect. But next week, I want to stand next to you at a press conference where you declare for Jeff's seat in the House.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Dick -- no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing to be afraid of, Vera. With your name, you can't lose. People around these parts are so used to voting for Jeff Johnson -- why, Mrs. Jeff Johnson would win in a walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dick, I was a Washington wife for twenty years. Twenty years of Potomac bullshit is plenty for one lifetime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vera, we're talking about becoming a Member of Congress. We're talking about a sure thing. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              16. 23   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about running the office -- I'll be there night and day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you would, dear. But I couldn't give you the same job satisfaction Jeff gave you. Jennifer, embarrassed, didn't know Vera knew.    Nor did Dodge. 24   OMITTED                                                      24 25   EXT. CONDOMINUM COMPLEX - DAY                                25 A retirement community in the Florida sunshine. 26   INT. CONDO ELEVATOR/HALLWAY - DAY - THE ELEVATOR DOORS       26 open. A supermarket shopping cart full of groceries, tied with a big bow, rolls out, pushed by Tommy. Loretta accompanies him. Tommy BUZZES at a door. It's answered by Tommy's GRANDMA, a limber lady in leggings and a bright top. She sees the groceries, kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is very sweet of you, darling. But you shouldn't have done it. Where did you get the money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to know. 27   INT. GRANDMA'S CONDO - DAY                                   27 Tommy and Loretta are watching the track results on the local tv news. Tommy, playing solitaire, shuffles bril- liantly. Grandma comes in from the kitchen, shaking her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did I end up with a thief for a grandson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandma -- I told you.    I'm not a thief. I'm a con man.     An artist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But also a crook. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             17. 27   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I only con crooks, Grandma. You can't con an honest man. Only somebody who wants something for nothing. (pause) But the good Lord must have been fond of pigeons, because he made so many of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes I just wish you were more like your Daddy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean, dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, smartmouth... I mean someone who made something of himself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: As Zeke's face flushes in anger, Tommy SEES Bruno come into the room, blood in his eye. Tommy turns sharply and heads out the terrace doors to the -- 18   EXT. COURTYARD - DAY                                        18 Tommy conceals himself behind a pillar, across the court- yard, away from the Guests. But from another direction, Johnson and Andersen approach, arm in arm, and sit on a bench by the pillar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

MEMORIAL BRIDGE - MAGIC HOUR                          52 The bridge over the Potomac has a classic view of the Lincoln Memorial and the Washington Monument. Their taxi drives by. 53   OMITTED                                                    53 &                                                               & 54
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CANNON BUILDING - DAY                                 55 Morning. Tommy and cronies get out of a cab and bound up the grand flight of stairs. In b.g., the Capitol dome. 56   INT. CANNON GROUND FLOOR CORRIDOR/ELEVATOR - DAY           56 They walk the superb ground floor corridor of Cannon, salivating. Marble columns... chandeliers... grand offices. Real class. AT AN ELEVATOR with a sign above it -- MEMBERS ONLY -- they stop. Tommy presses the button. The door opens. The seated ATTENDANT gets a load of this group. Especially Loretta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, folks, this elevator's for Members only. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             36. 56   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay, they're with me. Sixth floor please. Cannon 609. I'm going to my office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said Members only.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am a Member. Now take us to six before I haul your ass in front of the committee on disrespectful behavior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elevator don't go to six. You have to get off at five and walk. 57   INT. CANNON STAIRWELL - DAY                                 57 Looking puzzled, they make their way up a drab stairwell. 58   INT. CANNON TOP FLOOR - DAY                                 58 Not classy. On one side of the hallway, the windows give out on a brutally ugly courtyard. On the other side of the hall are cages: windowless storage bins behind metal fences crammed with junk -- and an occasional xerox machine, Mr. Coffee, and pitiful staffer at a tiny desk. Tommy opens the door to 609. 59   INT. TOMMY'S RECEPTION AREA - DAY                           59 Tommy's office is a small, dark garret, with dirty car- peting, bare shelves, and a pile of bulging canvas U.S. Mail bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait here. He heads further into the office. 60   INT. TOMMY'S OFFICE - DAY                                   60 Equally unattractive.   Perched on the desk:   Reinhardt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, congressman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this shithole? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             37. 60   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh -- you missed the freshman   lottery for offices. They assign them    by draw. You didn't show for the    draw, so you got the worst office in   Congress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I missed what lottery?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was all in the briefing books I mailed you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else did I miss, Reinhardt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you hiring me, congressman? Tommy gives Reinhardt a good once-over, seeing him anew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're shaking me down, aren't you? Tommy laughs, then clasps Reinhardt's shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is fantastic, Reinhardt. I haven't been here five minutes, and you're shaking me down. God, I'm gonna love this town. You're hired, man. Just tell me what to do next. I don't want to miss out on any of the good shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dinner for new Members is tonight, at Union Station. Do you have black tie? BEGIN elegant, spirited classical MUSIC. 61   INT. UNION STATION - MAIN HALL - NIGHT                      61 With its hundred-foot barrel-vaulted ceiling and grand windows, the magnificent Beaux-Arts station has been beautifully restored. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             38. 61   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 62 A STRING QUARTET provides the music. Tommy and Loretta linger uncertainly near the entrance. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's meet some natives. Tommy leads her over to two Men, 30s, excellent haircuts. Both wear pins. He extends a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy Johnson, how'd you do, nice party, heck of a railroad station, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rafe Simon, freshman from Tulsa. And this is Bo Chandler -- BO -- from Lufkin, Texas. You must be the one who didn't come to Harvard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I couldn't, it was my Princeton reunion....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff Johnson? You're Jeff Johnson? The guy from Florida?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rest of us are out there on the campaign trail, raising money, kissing ass, making speeches, dragging our butts from place to place -- and he slides in on pure name recognition! (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            39. 62   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me tell you something, Jeff. A tense beat.   Then Rafe breaks into a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuckin' brilliant. Bo winks at Tommy. Tommy Thank you. Thank you both very much. (to Loretta) Isn't that nice, now, don't you think? (to Rafe and Bo) This is Miss Loretta, boys. She extends a regal hand to each, Liza Doolittle at the ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do yo do.    How do you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it's Tommy. My friends call me Tommy. "Jeff" is my... professional name. So what line of work were you boys in before you got elected? You lawyers or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no, I did morning weather and traffic for KTOK in Tulsa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't remember me? I was a tight end for the Oilers -- my knee gimped out. The origins of the gentlemen's political success is not lost on Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, stop by my reception after the swearing in tomorrow, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but don't you go to his reception before you go to my reception. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            40. 62    CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, but I'm gonna be real offended if either of you miss my reception. They leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we have to have a reception. AT THE BUFFET, as Tommy and Loretta help themselves generously to oysters and champagne, they overhear TWO MEMBERS passing by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So then I ran an ad calling him a draft dodger, but then he ran an ad calling me a plagiarist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, leaked a rumor that his father- in-law was a Nazi. I went up ten points in a weekend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in the majors, doll. 62A   THE BALCONY is full of people working one another. As      62A Tommy and Loretta pass some large stone statues, a man extends his hand -- liquor lobbyist KEN KORNGOLD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congressman? I'd like to introduce myself. Ken Korngold. National Distilled Spirits Association.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy Johnson. Distilled Spirits, is that right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's super that you won, congressman. Any way we can help, please don't hesitate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleasure's all mine, Ken, hope you can make it to my reception. Do you happen to have a card? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             41. 62A   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sure do. 63    INT. UNION STATION - MEN'S ROOM - NIGHT                     63 Tommy is along a wall where other guests are similarly occupied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You now what I love about this place? The way everyone calls you a Member.  Every time I hear that, it makes me think of Mr. Happy here. The Member next to him bursts out laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you be peeing on my shoe. They go to the sinks.    The Member introduces himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike Strangland. Iowa -- first CD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a CD?    Shit, I missed that, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First Congressional district.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohhh. Tommy Johnson. Florida. So Iowa -- how'd you get to Washington? You do the crop report on tv? IOWA has a big open face and a flat Midwestern voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- I owe it all to the Vietnamese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: War hero?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .O.W. When I got back to Cedar Rapids, I spent so many years telling the Rotary Club what was wrong in Washington, they finally told me to put up or shut up -- so I put up. And here I am. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              42. 63   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute. What's wrong in Washington?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon -- there's acid rain killing fish, and no one's stopping it... there's topsoil washing away, and no erosion program... there's chemicals in our livestock -- God, I sound like a Boy Scout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's alright, Iowa -- this place could use a few geeks like you. 64   INT. UNION STATION - ADIRONDACKS - TOMMY'S DINNER            64 TABLE - NIGHT Tommy shakes hands around the table, taking business cards as he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pete Slocum.   Asbestos Information Institute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike Gustofson. Freedom to Advertise Coalition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul Zeckhauser. American Tobacco Council.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey... thank you... nice to see you... hope you can make it to my reception. Have y'all met Miss Loretta? TOMMY'S TABLEMATE is lawyer-lobbyist TOMMY O'CONNOR, 40s. As Waiters serve lobster bisque, he hands TJ a business card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy O'Connor. Soon as I saw how you got elected, I knew you were a real comer. Hell, I bet old Olaf Andersen voted for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's Olaf Andersen? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             43. 64   CONTINUED:                                                  64 O'Connor points.    ON THE DAIS, Andersen is engrossed with Dodge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't tell him you asked. Chairman of Gulf Coast Power. Constituent of yours, client of mine. BACK TO SCENE O'CONNOR Pays the rent, know what I    mean? Say, could I host a little    welcome- to-Washington thing for you    down at my law firm? Meet some of     my clients, five hundred a head -- you    could pick up twenty, twenty-five    grand to get you started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how much of that do you get?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh,    it doesn't come off the top. Down    the road, I'll bill 'em each five    hundred an hour whenever I take    you to lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy, I think this is the beginning of a beautiful relationship. 65   INT. UNION STATION - ADIRONDACKS - NIGHT - ON DODGE         65 making a speech from the dais.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tonight we unite the two great pillars of our system -- political and financial. To the forty-four newly-elected Members of Congress, I say, Look around you tonight. Look around, and be thankful for the generosity. Tommy inspects the sea of barracudas. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            44. 65   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The people you see not only provided tonight's hospitality. They are the people you serve. That's our system of checks and balances at its best. Their support helped get you elected... your work will help them... and their support will help you in your next campaign, which I remind you is already less than two years away. 66   INT./EXT. ADIRONDACKS - LARGE DOORS - NIGHT                66 In b.g., the Capitol dome. As Tommy and Loretta leave, they pass Dick Dodge, who is saying goodnight to guests. He stops them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Mr. Johnson, it's customary for new Members to pay a courtesy call on the old fogies in the leadership. Especially from their HOME STATE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I would have, but I just got to town. It's an honor to meet you, sir. A real privilege. This is Miss Loretta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Public liaison. She pronounces the word so carefully, it sounds lewd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you    do? (to    Tommy) You could    make up for it by having a nightcap    with me. (to    Loretta) May I have    my car take you home? 67   EXT. CAPITOL HILL - NIGHT                                  67 Tommy and Dodge walk up steps toward the Capitol. 68   INT. HALLWAY - CAPITOL - NIGHT                             68 A darkened hallway. A hand-lettered sign by a door reads COMMITTEE ON POWER AND INDUSTRY. THE CHAIRMAN. MR. DODGE. Tommy and Dodge approach. As Dodge unlocks the door: (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            45. 68   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Mr. Chairman, but this ain't no homo shit we up to, is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  No, it's not. But -- (amused) Good thinking, Johnson. I'm impressed by your instincts. 69   INT. DODGE'S OFFICE - CAPITOL - NIGHT                      69 A single table lamp lights Dick Dodge's office, reflecting off the velvet drapes, sculpted ceiling, and crystal chandeliers. Tommy and Dodge are in leather armchairs, ties undone. On the table between them, a bottle of Jim Beam. Dodge casts a cool eye on Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, Johnson. Why did you come to Washington?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... of course... it's a chance to do something for my country. I mean, there's the topsoil thing, and acid rain is killing the cattle -- DODGE Cut the bullshit, Johnson. I saw how you got elected. Flukes like you are either nutcases or troublemakers. I just want to know which one I have on my hands. Who sent you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one sent me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You pulled off that upset on your own?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kid's got his talents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm impressed, Johnson, I am.     But why did you run for Congress?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No bullshit? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              46. 69   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Opportunity knocks.    This town is the fuckin' Yukon. A stunned silence from Dodge -- then deep and generous laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a refreshing answer. He laughs again, richly amused.   Tommy joins in the laughter. 70   EXT. CANNON - DAY                                            70 Shining in the bright sun. 71   INT. TOMMY'S OFFICE - DAY - ON TOMMY'S DESK                  71 Hundreds of business cards. An expert riffle, a one- handed cut, and Tommy deals lightning fast, a perfect diamond formation with two cards in the middle. He turns them over one at a time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Food... drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ken Korngold, National Distilled Spirits Association. Bob Rafferty ...Wisconsin Cheese Board. (to Tommy) What do you want me to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're on cheese. I'll handle booze. He reaches for the phone... 72   EXT. DISTILLER'S BUILDING - DAY                              72 Pan from Capitol Hill to gleaming glass office building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ken! Ken Korngold! Tommy Johnson here... Right -- last night. How's it going, big guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congressman! THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            47. 73   INT. KORNGOLD'S OFFICE - DAY                               73 Expensive furniture, rugs, and art.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you on this helluva fine day! I'm looking forward to your reception. INTERCUT TOMMY AND KORNGOLD TOMMY Actually, that's why I'm calling, Ken. You said if I needed some help -- KORNGOLD You name it, congressman. Issue papers, testimony, floor speeches -- TOMMY Tell you what I have in mind. I was just thinking, wouldn't it be a plus for old Ken Korngold if I was to -- how should I put this -- showcase some of his distillers' products at my reception? You know, like they put Reese's pieces in E.T.? It's called "product placement." People come in, they have a tremendous time, they see your products, they think well of you -- and they think well of me, too. It's good for both of us, Ken. What do you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's a new one on me, but hey, sure, I think we can help you out.  Say, while I have you on the line, there was one thing... 74   INT. HOUSE CHAMBER - DAY                                   74 The SPEAKER administers the oath of office to the assembled House.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you solemnly swear that you will support and defend the Constitution of the United States... ON GRANDMA next to Tommy, eyes welling with pride. It's the one day a year that non-Members (meaning families) can be on the floor. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              48. 74   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... against all enemies, foreign and domestic; that you will bear true faith and allegiance to the same... 75   INT. TOMMY'S OFFICE - DAY - VIDEO - WIDE SHOT OF HOUSE       75 The 435 Members (with family) taking the oath, watched on C-span by Loretta, Armando, Van Dyke, and Reinhardt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... that you take this obligation freely, without any mental reservation or purpose of evasion... 76   INT. HOUSE CHAMBER - DAY                                     76 ON IOWA taking the oath, his toddler in his arms.     PAN along faces of other Members... to Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and that you will well and faithfully discharge the duties of the office on which you are about to enter. So help you God?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations. You are now Members of Congress. Sustained APPLAUSE.   Tommy kisses Grandma. INTERCUT Tommy's cronies APPLAUDING. ON THE FLOOR Tommy dries Grandma's tears with a finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just that -- I'm so happy you straightened out. Tommy smiles ambiguously. As APPLAUSE continues, his eyes roam the room and make contact with Dick Dodge, standing at one of the leadership tables. Tommy winks conspiratorially at him. There's such diabolical glee in it, it even takes Dodge aback. 77   INT. CANNON TOP FLOOR - DAY                                  77 A beautiful black woman, 20s, walks briskly down the busy Cannon corridors. CELIA. There's intelligence in her eyes, and fire. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            49. 77   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an informal breakfast. You give us your views, we give you bacon and eggs, plus a couple of thousand dollar honorarium. (winking) For your favorite charity. Tommy looks at Reinhardt, who explains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tommy Johnson Foundation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honorarium. I like that. Loretta appears with a platter of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Herring, gentlemen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, no thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? We've got it in cream sauce and in wine sauce. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            49A. 78   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'll pass. Tommy steers her aside and takes a roll of soggy, toothpick-impaled herring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this?    Where's the cheese?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cheese guy didn't return my call. So I called the guy at the American Smoked Fish Institute. She points at the food table. There's nothing but a few boxes of crackers and two huge mounds of herring -- one white, one pink. The centerpiece is a large smoked fish, eyes staring accusingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that's just wonderful. Sixty heavy hitters drop in, and I'm feeding 'em cat food. He breaks off, as Celia comes into view in the doorway behind. Tommy picks her up on his radar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll talk about this later. We follow Tommy through the crowd until he reaches Celia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi   there. Glad you could make it. So   you're... Celia Kirby. That's an   extremely beautiful name. For an   extremely beautiful woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow! That's smooth. After ten straight hours on my feet making small talk and breathing cheap cigar smoke, that's exactly the kind of line I'm ready to fall for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, slow down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, sure, forget it. Can you just tell me, which one's Congressman Johnson? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            49B. 78   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if I said... me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. I see. So tell me, Congressman, just how deep is the shit I'm standing in? Tommy has to laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it. Why don't we just start over again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Celia Kirby. I'm the legislative director of Pro Bono.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah. Pro Bon. That's an extremely beautiful name. For an extremely beautiful organization. Um... what is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're a public interest research and advocacy group. I'd like to brief you on our priorities this session. Can I call your AA to get on your schedule?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you brief me over dinner tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want an appointment, Congressman, not a date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, sure, we'll type it up on the schedule, it'll be an appointment, except with wine and flowers on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks.   I really should be going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Won't you at least stay for a drink and some herring? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             49C. 78   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid I'm busy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then, can I tempt you with a smelt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks. (extending her hand) Nice to meet you. I'll be in touch with your office. I especially look forward to hearing your view on extending the sexual harassment law to include congressmen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love the way you say that. She slips out through the sea of revelers. 79   EXT. CAPITOL - DAY                                         79 A fine Washington morning. 80   OMITTED                                                    80 81   EXT. CAPITOL STEPS - DAY                                   81 Rep. ELIJAH MARSHALL, 50s, black, and a pain in Dodge's ass, is shaking hands and saying goodbye to some Constituents. Dodge approaches. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 3/25/92            50. 81   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard in the steam room you're going to try to screw up my ethics bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not screw up.    Amend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Eli, your amendments don't have a chance in hell to pass. My bill isn't perfect, I know, but it'll pass. And the President'll sign it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Isn't perfect"? Dick, your bill's the Incumbents Protection Act! How can you even call it an ethics bill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because the public wants an ethics bill! So that's what we call it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's got no teeth! It won't change a thing, and you know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Eli, you're a politician, too. The less you're going to do about something, the more you have to talk about it. You know that. They start walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. We close the bank, we stop the rubber checks, we raise the prices in the barber shop, we stop fixing parking tickets, and abracadabra! We say we've cleaned up Congress. Well, I don't think the American people want what this place has become.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the beauty of it! They must, Eli -- they keep re-electing us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not anymore! This new Congress is full of new faces. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            51. 81   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I wouldn't read too much into that. A few extra retirements, some redistricting -- nothing more than that. It's still business as usual up here. Dodge takes his glasses from his pocket and wipes them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I live in the real world, Eli. Do you? What's unemployment up to in your district? Eight percent? Eight-five?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight point six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Power and Enterprise is about to fund a solar demonstration plant, Eli. It could mean a whole lot to a district -- new jobs, new construction -- that interest you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't bribe me, Dick. 82   INT. DODGE'S RECEPTION AREA - DAY                          82 Dodge and Marshall enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eli, the people who elected you. They sent you here to help them. Don't you want to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not  if it means supporting your bill. All  you want is the perfect platform to  campaign for Speaker. Dick Dodge. Mr.  Clean. What a joke!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on board, Eli. (leaning in) You know -- you can't save the world if you can't save your seat. Tommy enters.   Marshall gives him a once-over and extends a hand. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            52. 82   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We haven't met. Eli Marshall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy Johnson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. The Florida upset. Well, now that you're here, what are you going to do with it? You gonna feather your own nest, or are you gonna make something of your office?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I plan to be as good a congressman as all the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly what does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, ever since I got back from Nam, I've wanted to do something about the rain forest -- MARSHALL No, do me a favor, don't tell me. I try not to get depressed until the second week of a new session.
