direction.raw_text: So why do you do it? She skips a stone on the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, it's so embarrassing to come out and say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meaning. I need my life to mean something. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92               69. 103   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This actually hits Tommy.    Celia, embarrassed, changes the subject.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My question is, how'd you get named after a Memorial?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandma like Jefferson. Y'know, "Life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness." It's a lot to live up to, so I specialized in the last part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how's the pursuit going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine...'til I met you. Now...the better I do, the worse I feel. They have stopped walking.    They are standing close together. They kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...when can I see you again? How about dinner Saturday night? She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about Sunday morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brunch? 104   INT. OLD CHURCH - BALTIMORE - DAY                             104 In the pulpit, Rev. Elijah Marshall thunders:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wages of sin is death! And to the man who values Gold over Goodness...the Lord allows no exemptions! REVEAL TOMMY and Celia in the front pew. Marshall appears to be preaching directly to Tommy, who wears a slightly sick smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the man who shows no respect for the privilege of walking this Earth, God allows no deductions! (MORE) (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            70. 104   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And to the man whose pockets are bulging and whose soul is empty... the Lord grants no 90-day extension! (AMEN) And when the last trump sounds, believe me, you will be audited!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is one hell of a date. 105   EXT. CHURCH - DAY                                          105 On the steps, Marshall shakes hands with his Congregants. Tommy and Celia exit the church. Marshall takes Celia by the hands and kisses her familiarly. Tommy is taken aback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, darling. Glad you could make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I liked the sermon, Uncle Eli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uncle Eli?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My niece says you're not half as slimy as I thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your niece?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would put you somewhere between a lizard and a toad. Quite a step up. Tommy looks from Marshall to Celia and back again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could I have missed the family resemblance? 106   EXT. CANNON BUILDING - DAY - ESTABLISHING                  106 107   INT. CANNON TOP FLOOR - DAY                                107 WHISTLING happily, Tommy rounds the corner and heads to his office. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92           71. 107   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahead of him, encamped in the hallway, he sees a phalanx of SENIOR CITIZENS, many carrying placards, and some camera crews. Tommy adjusts his tie, turns on the charm, and approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies! Looking good!   How can I help you folks today! But Hattie Rifkin and her troops will have none of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't "Ladies!" me, you dick! The camera lights go on. 108   INT. DODGE'S OFFICE - DAY                                 108 DODGE Now let me get this straight. You voted to make people on Medicare pay more money to their doctors?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Medical Association made a persuasive case. Ten grand from their PAC, plus Christmas in Aspen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy -- if I'm not mistaken, you wouldn't be here without the good senior citizens of your district. You got to dance with the girl that brung you, son. If you have a bit of business to do, do it quietly... in the corridors... in the subcommittees... with little amendments. You mess around on the big ones like Medicare, you'll be dead meat on election day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, then it's thanks for the memories, and on to the next gig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what your problem is, son? You don't think big enough. You have a real knack for this town, but you have the soul of a two-bit hustler. Listen to me, Tommy. (MORE) (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            72. 108   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five hundred thirty-five Members of Congress. Some are smart, and some stupid. Some good, some not. But all of them, son, all of them consumed by the single overriding imperative that defines the very Washington way of life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Getting re-elected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute. You're talkin' 'bout my re-election?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know what percent of the incumbents who ran last time got re-elected, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty?   Sixty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ninety-six. And ninety-eight before that. It's like that election after election. If you don't fuck up, you can be here, raking it in, for life. Life, Johnson. Tommy considers this.   Then a big smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can think of worse places to get life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew you had it in you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how do I get the Silver Foxes off my ass?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, throw them a bone... why don't you co-sponsor a bill for mandatory universal health insurance? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            73. 108   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.   It'll never pass. 109   INT. TOMMY'S RECEPTION AREA - DAY                          109 A couple of Lobbyists await Tommy. Van Dyke mans the desk. In come ELLEN JUBA, 40s, and her 13-year-old daughter, MICKEY, whose pony tail sticks out from her Florida Marlins baseball cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm Ellen Juba. This is my daughter, Mickey. We'd like to see our congressman. We live in the district.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a moment, please. (dials; into phone) Could you come out? Thank you. (hanging up) Be right with you. (to Mickey) I like your hat. Loretta comes out and extends a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you do, I'm Miss Loretta, public liaison for the congressman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellen Juba. My daughter Mickey. We'd like to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'all from the district? Up    here seein' the sights? How'd you    folks like some gallery passes? Go    on over and listen to the great   debates of our day? She reaches into Van Dyke's desk drawer to get some passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't want to go to the gallery. We want to see Congressman Johnson. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            74. 109   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout a House key ring for each of you? Here -- see that? Isn't that something? Turns into a pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't understand. We're not tourists. We're constitutents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You aren't with some organization, are you, honey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a goddam citizen! Isn't that enough!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not leaving here till we see him! Loretta exchanges a look with the Lobbyists, who get the picture. She picks up the phone and speaks nonchalantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Armando? Could you come out front, please? Tommy enters, carrying an enormous tennis trophy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look what I won! Must be that new racket. Armando has come out to hear this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There a problem, congressman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congressman?   You? Armando tries to escort her out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your hands off me! Mickey tries to block Armando.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go of her, you creep! (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92                 75. 109   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful, she may be armed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it!     Get away from her! Armando, defending himself from Mickey, manages to knock her hat off. With the hat comes her (apparently false) pony tail. ON MICKEY.   She's bald.    Her skull bears the mark of surgery. Everyone stops.    It's quiet. Mickey's eyes burn into Tommy's.        Then she picks up her hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Ma.      It's okay.    Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait.     What happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy and his staff listen to the Jubas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was lucky. They said they got it all. I'm going to be okay. But what about the others?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They call it a "cancer cluster." Oh, at first, none of us in the neighborhood wanted to believe it, but then we all saw it -- for me, it was when the two-year-old across the street developed a brain tumor, same as Mickey. We looked at everything -- the water, the air, dump sites, insects, you name it. But we didn't have to look that far. It was staring us in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            76. 110   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Power lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: High-voltage power lines. The wires cause magnetic fields -- and the magnetic fields cause cancer. Especially in children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never heard of that. Mickey pulls a stack of journals and xeroxes from her book bag and gives it to her mother, who in turn gives the materials to Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The studies, the numbers -- it's all there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not actually going to read those, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, they'll be read...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you come see for yourself? Tommy has no quick answer. 111   EXT. PARK/SCHOOL - FLORIDA - DAY                           111 Children playing on swings and seesaws in a small public park. TILT UP. A pair of electric power derricks carrying 225,000-volt lines almost directly overhead. The derricks cast shadows across a nearby school. We SEE the neighborhood. Quite a few FOR SALE signs. A house with a moving sale in progress on the front lawn. ON Tommy taking it all in.   With him are Celia and the Jubas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five children   in the neighborhood have cancer.    One more has precancerous   lesions. Pregnant women around   here are scared to death. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            77. 111   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Mickey's school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turns out a lot of schools are near power lines. The land's cheap, so the schools tend to buy it from the power companies in the first place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But isn't the school district responsible?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We asked the superintendent to measure the magnetic field inside the school. He said, Okay, only it'll cost forty thousand dollars, and what program did we want him to cut that from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're nobody, congressman. You're somebody. We need your help. Tommy takes Celia aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you believe it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's impossible to know. No one's really looked into it hard enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why isn't it being investigated?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't they investigate breast implants all those years? What about those side-effects of that sleeping pill, Halcion? Why isn't anything being investigated? It's always the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Money talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got it. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             78. 111    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There must be something I can do for those people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me you're actually developing a conscience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, I hope not -- it'd be a fucking nuisance in Congress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that's not fair. Some people on the Hill actually believe in things, and try to do a decent job, and don't forget why they went to Washington, and who sent them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No shit. (remembering) Oh, yeah, I met one of those geeks. So what can I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make a stink. Round up some Members and hold a press conference. Get that committee of yours to hold hearings. Haul in in the Environmental Protection Agency, the Surgeon General, the National Academy of Sciences. Get the issue on every breakfast table in America. 112    OMITTED                                                     112 112A   INT. POWER AND ENTERPRISE COMMITTEE - DAY                   112A A press conference. Half a dozen congressmen, Tommy among them. Iowa is speaking to the few Cameras and Reporters. Beside him, Mickey Juba and her mother. Reinhardt and Ceila among the handful of staff and onlookers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This goes beyond personal tragedy. It goes to a public health hazard of unknown proportions. It goes to the right of ordinary people to know all the facts -- (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              79. 112A   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, right -- people ought to know if their neighborhoods are killing them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amen, gentleman. Amen. They turn, somewhat surprised to see Dick Dodge, who joins Iowa at the microphones, a natural leader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a fine effort this is. I am totally sympathetic. Congressional hearings should be scheduled as soon as possible. The American people deserve no less. He puts an arm around Mickey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Message:   we care. 112B   INT. TOMMY'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                   112B Tommy and Celia are watching the press conference on TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, congratulations. You've found yourself your own hopeless cause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speaking of hopeless causes... They kiss, and slide OUT OF FRAME. 113    OMITTED                                                      113 &                                                                   & 114
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DODGE'S OFFICE - NIGHT                                  115 An impressive THUNDERSTORM pounds on Dodge's windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the rocks, or neat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you're having. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            80. 115   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, why ruin good bourbon with the taste of some shitty Sears icemaker, that's what I always say. (handing Tommy a glass) Cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheers. Dodge downs his drink.   Tommy follows suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son, you're a real comer. I wouldn't be surprised if you ended up in the leadership. I'll say this: if I were Speaker, I'd sleep better with you as a lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, thank you, Mr. Chairman. You know, to tell you the truth, I didn't know you'd be on my side on those power lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you said you were sympathetic -- DODGE Of course I did. We're all sympathetic to little girls with cancer. But I'm not sympathetic to holding an inquiry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you said -- DODGE I know what I said. But that was just a press conference, son. I wasn't under oath. The intercom BUZZES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?... Bring them right in! (hanging up) Look. Son. It's great to get your name in the paper. (MORE) (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             81. 115   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet the gentleman from Iowa was all over the evening news in Des Moines tonight. Getting good press -- letting them know you care -- that's what it's all about. Smart move, Tommy. But that's as far as I'd go with this, if I were you. The door opens. Dodge turns to see Olaf Anderson, Tommy O'Connor, and Zeke Bridges enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a surprise!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Chairman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Chairman! Hello, Tommy. Zeke you're looking well, good to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good to see you, you old sum' bitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evening, Mr. Chairman, thanks for taking the -- Tommy, you s.o.b., they let you in here? (indicating Andersen and Bridges) You folks finally get to press flesh! Olaf, meet Tommy Johnson. Tommy, Olaf Andersen. Chairman of Gulf Coast Power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boys here have told me a lot about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- I told him you voted for him! They all share a laugh.    Except for Bridges, who squints at Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glad to meet you, son. They tell me you've got a real talent for the game. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            81A. 115   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is Zeke Bridges, CEO of Pyramid Insurance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congressman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me with these, would you, Tommy? He hands Tommy a couple of drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chivas on the rocks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look awfully familiar. Tommy just smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy and I were just talking about power lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, what a coincidence. I thought this little party might be for me. (to Anderson) You may not like this. (to Dodge) I think we should hold those hearings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really fell for the line that parents group fed you, didn't you? Tommy is struck by Dodge's intelligence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you know I met the parents group? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            81B. 115   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I keep my ear to the ground, that's what a good politician does. Listen, Tommy, why don't we just get Olaf's take on this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's tragic, cancer's a terrible thing, but there's no way you can link it to power lines. Truth is, there's a bigger electromagnetic field given off by an electric blanket, or a microwave oven, than by those derricks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there are studies that say -- ZEKE For every study that says one thing, I'll show you a study saying another. We've studied it ourselves. Nada.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's not a single state health official anywhere in this country who says power lines cause cancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what if you're wrong? As Tommy persists, Andersen looks increasingly angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People didn't use to say smoking causes cancer, either. What if the evidence is just building, and some day we wake up and discover that your power lines are killing us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Kill  us"? "Kill us"? You calling me a  murderer? You're saying there's blood  on these hands? How dare you talk  to me like that, you -- O'Connor puts a restraining arm on Andersen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down, Olaf, calm down, he didn't mean it that way, did you, son? Alright, gentlemen. Easy. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             82. 115   CONTINUED:   (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andersen backs off, regains his composure.    The outburst makes an impression on Tommy. Tommy I'm just saying, it's worth looking into.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy -- do you want to move the power lines? Do you know how much it would cost to bury them? Millions. Tens of millions. I don't have that money. The state doesn't have that money. You people up here sure don't have that money. You know who'd end up paying for it? Folks who sent you here, that's who.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now how'd you like the   people in your district to think   of you as the putz who tripled their   electric bill? You think they'd thank   you for that on election day?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I'm saying is, maybe we should hold hearings to look at -- O'CONNOR Think for a minute, boychik. You hold your hearings. Overnight, everyone who lives near a substation finds the value of his home in the toilet. You kill the real estate market.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You kill the insurance companies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You kill the school district.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You kill the local economy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a smart boy, you're not thinking very politically. Tommy watches the LIGHTNING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I should think about it. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             83. 115   CONTINUED:   (6)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, the system ain't perfect, but the fleas come with the dawg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, by the    way, Tommy, on a completely different    subject -- You don't have a state PAC    yet, do you? I'd like to give you a    hundred thousand dollar corporate    contribution to start one up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My company would be honored to do the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you do that?     I thought there were limits -- O'CONNOR Oh, it's all aboveboard, we all believe deeply in the rules. It's just that the state rules are often more flexible about these things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you interested?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm always interested in the happiness of my constituents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll drink to that. Dodge and Andersen shoot each other a look. 116   OMITTED                                                     116 &                                                                 & 117
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOMMY'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                  118 Tommy pulls up in a Corvette with Florida congressional plates in front of his Capitol Hill row house. 119   INT. TOMMY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT                                119 Tommy slips into bed next to Celia, who's half asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmm... (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            84. 119   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what did he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge.    The hearings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh -- I, uh, haven't asked him yet. Celia suddenly looks quite awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't the right moment. Besides, I was thinking, maybe I ought to line up some other Members first -- you know, get my ducks in a row.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. 120   INT. HOUSE STEAM ROOM - DAY                                120 Dick Dodge and several other towel-clad MEMBERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see that ABC poll?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Free fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: President in trouble like that, he's liable to do something desperate. Some damn fool stunt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Invade Japan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Declare war on Congress, more like it. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 3/25/92             85A. 120   CONTINUED:   (A1)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door opens.     Eli Marshall, fully dressed, comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shafted me on the ethics bill. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            86. 120   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Eli, good to see you.   Why don't you loosen your tie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a closed rule. I can't get my amendments on the floor. I can't get a recorded vote. I can't get squat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last time I looked, it was the Rules Committee in charge of that. This isn't the Rules Committee, Eli. This is the steam room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the U.S. Congress! The American people deserve better than -- DODGE You know what your problem is, Eli? You've got sermonitis. The other Members chuckle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't open your mouth without climbing into the pulpit, can you? Why don't you just calm down, have a massage -- MARSHALL I've got news for you, Dick. I'm going to run against you for Speaker. I may not have a rat's ass of a chance to beat you. But I sure as hell can tell the world the kind of sleaze you stand for. 121   EXT. CAPITOL TERRACE - DAY - TOMMY AND DODGE               121 DODGE I went too far with him, I know it. You know him pretty well, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, you play basketball together, you're seeing his niece, you've been to his church -- TOMMY How did you know that? (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             87. 121   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge indicates his bloodhound nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll listen to you, Tommy. I want you to go make peace between us. Tell him we'll work something out on his amendments -- not a vote, I won't go that far, but at least he'll get to say his piece on the floor. Just get him off my back. Can you do that for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not a question, is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.     Is there a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no -- I've still got my right nut, I can work with that. 122   INT. CRAB HOUSE - NIGHT                                     122 A WAITER removes an empty pitcher of beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another?

direction.raw_text: You better believe it. You're screwed, too. Every hot dog trial lawyer in America soon be lining up to sue both our asses. We got to move on this, Olaf. If I wasn't tied up here, I'd go to Washington myself. Shouldn't you be getting on a plane? Just between us -- you find a way to stop this, I'll find a million bucks if I have to. 151   INT. CORPORATE JET - DAY                                  151 A very worried Andersen. 152   INT. HILL CORRIDOR - DAY                                  152 Tommy and Dodge walking along a Capitol hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Olaf will be at my office at five o'clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we play it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool. Real cool. You just follow my lead. 153   INT. DODGE'S OFFICE - DAY - DODGE, TOMMY, ANDERSEN,       153 O'CONNOR DODGE I don't know how I can help you on this one, Olaf. This is the EPA. This is the President.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my lifeblood!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see that, Olaf, I see that. But in this town, you pick your fights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This could mean six figures, Dick. Dodge says nothing, but makes his eyebrows fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: High six figures. Dodge flicks his eyebrows again:   More. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             104. 153   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven figures?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Between us. It's not that much -- what can you get for half a million these days?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell can I funnel that kind of money to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If that's what you want, we can always find a loophole. No one will see your fingerprints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one will know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one will know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're only in trouble if someone can prove a connection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course there's no connection. Olaf's just making a contribution as a patriotic citizen. And in return for it, he's getting -- TOMMY Good government.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly.   A little access, that's all. 154   INT. ORNATE CAPITOL HALLWAY - DAY                         154 Dodge, Andersen, Tommy, and O'Connor walking along. Up ahead, a cocktail reception. On an easel by the door: HAZARDOUS WASTE ASSOCIATION MEET YOUR REPRESENTATIVE NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to do a drop-by. You gentlemen like to join me for a drink? 155   INT. ORNATE FUNCTION ROOM - DAY                           155 Dodge and Tommy work the room genially. Tommy spots Celia talking to some Guests and goes over to her. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            105. 155   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. She turns, starts to walk away.   Tommy stops her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. Whatever you think of me, just promise me one thing. She glares at him angrily.   But then she's surprised to hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come to the Clean Air hearing tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Power and Enterprise.    Noon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why? He gives her an enigmatic smile and slips away. As he rejoins Dodge, Tommy SEES WARBURTON enter the room. Alarmed, TOmmy moves in on Dodge, steering him to avoid the EPA Administrator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't we be heading off, Dick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's work the room just a bit more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congressman!   Mr. Chairman! As Dodge turns to see him -- DODGE Evening, Reinhardt. -- he SEES Warburton. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            106. 155   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good to see you, sir.    By the way, I thought your opening   statement in committee yesterday was   brilliant. Dodge points out Warburton to Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. Look who's over there -- Skeeter Warburton from the EPA. The very man we want to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you tried the oysters, Dick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At a hazardous waste event? (shakes head) I think we'll go talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he's the wrong man -- DODGE (bemused by Tommy) You don't understand -- he's the perfect man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But -- but you don't want to bother him with this. Talk to one of his underlings -- Dodge looks at Tommy with curiosity, not understanding his reluctance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing beats man-to-man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here?     Not here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A public place. What could be better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's the wrong time!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While the iron is hot, son. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92               107. 155   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No time like the present.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Reinhardt, I'm talking to the Chairman. Beat it, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go get him. Reinhardt heads for Warburton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard about this stomach thing going around?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, son, we've got the people's business to do. He leads Tommy off to one side.      Reinhardt brings Warburton to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Chairman.    Congressman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got a big problem, Skeeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your power lines investigation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What power lines investigation? Tommy is sweating bullets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're off the record, Skeeter. This witch-hunt for cancer clusters is bad news for everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about, Dick. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             108. 155   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, I know you're being a good soldier -- WARBURTON No, I'm being straight with you -- DODGE Then let me be straight with you. You announce this study -- I'm not talking about the results down the road, mind you, I'm just talking about the announcement
direction.name: direction

result.heading: HAZARDOUS WASTE ASSOCIATION MEET YOUR REPRESENTATIVE NIGHT

direction.raw_text: and there's broken crockery everywhere. Real estate. Utilities. Insurance. Schools. Local governments. It'll cost jobs. Uproot families.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I agree with you completely. There isn't going to be an investigation, old chap, I promise you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad we understand each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I think we do. Tommy silently rejoices in his good fortune.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we'll just forget about that phone call this morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't speak on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. Dodge claps him on the shoulder, then heads off with Tommy, who is delighted to have dodged a bullet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "There isn't going to be an investigation, old chap."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're bad. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92           109. 155   CONTINUED:   (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They join up with Andersen and O'Connor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worked like a charm. We scared him shitless. The investigation's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waiter! Champagne! (to Dodge) See you at the Clear Air hearings. 156   INT. TOMMY'S RECEPTION AREA/CORRIDOR - DAY              156 As Reinhardt comes into the office, Tommy intercepts him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Reinhardt! Got a minute? I need your advice on something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Tommy leads him back into the corridor. 157   INT. TOMMY'S BOILER ROOM - DAY                          157 Van Dyke, Armando, and Loretta work the phones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this the assignment desk? Yes, I'm calling from Chairman Dodge's office, on the Hill. We wanted to be sure CNN was sending a crew to the Clean Air hearing today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not the new emission standards. We're breaking news. This is the biggest thing since Watergate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Cynthia Leeson in the White House Press Office. My boss wanted me to let you folks know -- we're making a major announcement at the Clean Air hearings today. (listens) No, I can't tell you, but it's hot. (listens) Well, if the New York Times wants to be the only paper in town to miss the story of the year, that's up to y'all. THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              109A. 158   INT. TOMMY'S CAGE/CORRIDOR - DAY                             158 Tommy has drawn Reinhardt into the cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to do a little    something nice for Dodge. That     EPA thing -- he's been good to me,    Reinhardt. Is there some way I can,    like, throw a bouquet to him at the    hearing today without having to sit    through that boring testimony    shit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you ask him to give you the floor at the start?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For some flattery? In a New York minute. Just tip him ahead of time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good thinking. They return to the corridor.     Tommy looks at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, Reinhardt, my Grandma's plane comes in at ten. You wouldn't mind picking her up and driving Miss Daisy around, would you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't one of the others do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't trust them the way I trust you. TOMMY pats him on the back and sends him on his way. 159   INT. TOMMY'S OFFICE - DAY                                    159 Tommy, joined by his cronies and the Jubas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it, people.     Game time.   Let's get it right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me one thing, jefe. How do you know Andersen is going to bite?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't.   You run a con, you run a risk. THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92             110. 160   INT. POWER AND ENTERPRISE COMMITTEE - DAY                 160 A hundred or so members of the public -- trade groups, Hill staffers, lawyers, tourists -- settle into their seats. VAN DYKE escorts Hattie Rifkin and a busload of Silver Foxes. Loretta comes in with Ellen and Mickey Juba. GRANDMA comes in, on Reinhardt's arm. She is dressed up as a biddy, down to a hat with fruit on it. COMMITTEE MEMBERS head for their seats at the dais. OLAF ANDERSEN is at the witness table, along with a couple of other businessmen. In a seat behind Andersen, Tommy O'Connor. THE PRESS.   A good turnout, with several camera crews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what this is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very hot. Electric cars. CELIA is seated with Ira, her Pro Bono associate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm cutting out early.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't want to run into him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got that right. AT THE DAIS Tommy has a private word with Dodge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dick, I thought it might be a nice way to open if I congratulated you on the fine work you been doin' on this committee. Really express our appreciation. Especially on behalf of the minority community.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, thank you, son. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            111. 160   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't hurt to have tape like that in the bank, would it, Mr. Speaker? HOMER slips in next to Reinhardt, who is surprised to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Yancey? Arthur Reinhardt.      Are you testifying for the agency?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Homer, dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Mrs. Johnson, you must be mistaken -- let me introduce you. This is Mr. Yancey of the EPA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be silly, child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Homer Norton. Homer's Pit Stop, Axahatchee, Florida.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Homer's known Tommy since they were in diapers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the -- ? From the row behind Reinhardt, Armando clamps Reinhardt down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move and you're history. DODGE GAVELS the meeting to order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This meeting of the Power and Enterprise Committee to consider the reauthorization of the Clean Air Act is now in session. Today's first business is a panel of national leaders in the field of utilities. (MORE) (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            112. 160   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before I welcome them, Chair would like to yield to the gentleman from Florida for a word. If there is no objection from the Committee -- ? The gentleman may proceed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Chairman, on behalf of the other members of this committee, and on behalf of myself, I have a very personal statement to make. From the bottom of my heart, I want to thank you -- thank you for your leadership, for your insight, for your boldness... Dodge preens for the cameras, until:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and for your courage. Especially your courage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My courage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your courage in exposing the corruption that eats away at this institution. Your courage in taking on the special interests. Your courage in taking a major new step -- DODGE But I've... I've... I've done nothing new, nothing at all -- what are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're    right -- integrity isn't new to you,    Mr. Chairman, it's second nature    to you. Still it's a rare public    servant who'll take on the special    interest money, take on the PACs -- ANDERSEN, wary, senses danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: take on the lobbyists and fat cats -- CELIA is fascinated. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            113. 160   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and who'll stand up instead for ordinary American citizens... ON ELLEN AND MICKEY JUBA TOMMY (O.S.) ... the plain people who just want peace of mind -- who just want to know they're raising their kids in safe neighborhoods and sending them to safe schools. ON THE DAIS Dodge wants to wrap this up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, courage, Mr. Chairman, is a quality that you have in abundance -- DODGE Well, yes, thank you, but we have to move along, if the gentleman would -- TOMMY (undeterred) Ladies and gentlemen, yesterday, the Chairman and I had a meeting in his office with Olaf Andersen of Gulf Coast Power, and his lobbyist, Mr. Tommy O'Connor -- (indicating) these gentlemen here. Chairman Dodge and I listened in astonishment as Olaf Andersen offered us seven figures -- that's one million dollars, ladies and gentlemen. A BUZZ in the room.   O'CONNOR leans forward to Andersen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge double-crossed us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fired. ON TOMMY TOMMY One million dollars, if we would stop the EPA from investigating the connection between power lines and cancer clusters. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            114. 160   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shocked MURMURS sweep the room. REINHARDT is aghast. HOMER and ARMANDO are delighted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't that right, Mr. Andersen? Tommy flicks his eyebrows at Andersen, provocatively, imitating Dodge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a vicious lie. Dodge GAVELS sharply, turns to Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will the gentleman yield?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not possible! You can't give anyone that kind of money! Dodge continues GAVELING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes, you can. As Mr. O'Connor said to you, quote: "If that's what you want, we can always find a loophole. No one will know." Remember saying that, Tommy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I insist that the gentlemen yield! Tommy also stands, and produces a video tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't deny it, Mr. Andersen! We have the whole thing on this tape! The room erupts. THE PRESS loves it. Still cameras CLICK and WHIR. DODGE despairs. REINHARDT puts his hand over his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yesterday, at Chairman Dodge's courageous suggestion, I taped the whole conversation. It's all there. Mr. Chairman, I thank you. The people thank you. America thanks you. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92               115. 160   CONTINUED:   (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The clapping is considerably sweetened by the Panthers and the rest of Tommy's claque. DODGE gauges their reaction, gets an inspiration. The storm leaves his face, and becomes a smile, which he beams on Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thank the distinguished gentleman. And I thank my fellow citizens. Our methods in this investigation may have been unorthodox, but together -- (indignant, at Andersen) we have exposed a canker at the very heart of democracy. APPLAUSE. Tommy is amazed at Dodge's survival skills. REINHARDT, delighted at the turn, claps heartily. ANDERSEN, livid, leaps up and shouts at Dodge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastard!    You set me up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witness is out of order!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stood to make a million bucks off of me! Who offered you more? I want to know! A new BUZZ sweeps the room. O'Connor tries to restrain Andersen, who sloughs him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're as big a whore as he is! MICKEY JUBA catches Tommy's eye and mouths a question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now? Tommy shakes his head:   no. 161   INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY                                   161 The phone by Eli Marshall's bed RINGS.    He answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?  No. You're joking. (to Man in next bed) You mind if I put on C-span? THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92            116. 162   INT. POWER AND ENTERPRISE COMMITTEE - DAY                 162 ANDERSEN There's no loyalty any more, is there, Dick? What about the three hundred grand you squeezed from me for that goddam voter registration front of yours -- that just water under the bridge? O'Connor tries again to restrain him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch me, you scum! MICKEY JUBA mouths:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now? Tommy shakes his head again.    No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the two hundred k for your phony foundation, Dick? How about the ten thousand copies if your goddam autobiography you muscled me to buy -- what's all that, ancient history? Andersen advances toward the dais, pointing now to six or seven other Members of the Committee among the total of 28.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you -- what about those bundled checks from my executives? I gave you my condo in Vail! I gave you my corporate jet to fly all over the world! I gave your kids summer jobs! I put up scholarships to put your kids through college! I hired your goddam wife to redecorate my office! You telling me none of that counts for anything? Andersen grabs Dodge by the throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you people were for sale! I was wrong -- you're just for rent! Dodge struggles free of Andersen, who is dragged away from Dodge by Capitol Police. (CONTINUED) THE DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN - Rev. 4/3/92              117. 162   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How dare you impugn my integrity! Everything I've done has been completely legal!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Chairman! You mean to say you did all that stuff? You took all that money? Shock in the room. Some BOOS. IOWA does a nice HOG CALL. TJ sends a little wave and smile to Celia.
